problems.title: Maximum Coins Collection
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have N piles of coins. The i-th pile has piles[i] coins.
In one move, you can pick any pile and take 1 coin from it.

You have K moves. Find the maximum number of coins you can collect.

Greedy Insight: Always pick from the pile with the most coins!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 4
5 3 2

Sample Output
15

Explanation:
Piles: [5, 3, 2], K = 4 moves
- Pick from pile 1 (5 coins): total = 5, piles = [4, 3, 2]
- Pick from pile 1 (4 coins): total = 9, piles = [3, 3, 2]
- Pick from pile 1 (3 coins): total = 12, piles = [2, 3, 2]
- Pick from pile 2 (3 coins): total = 15, piles = [2, 2, 2]

Maximum coins = 15
